page.title: 06EDUCATION IN HUNTINGDON.
page.content: A few of the children in Huntingdon attend a Nursery School from the age of four to five followed by an Infant School from five to seven. At seven they transfer to a Junior School until the age of eleven.The children are usually taught by one teacher for the year.They study maths, english and a variety of topics.At eleven they attend one of the two Comprehensive Schools. They are put into classes according to their ability and also study more specialist subjects, when at sixteen they take either O levels or CSE exams depending on their ability.Each subject is generally taught by a different teacher.If they do well there is an opportunity to do two years study for A levels. At sixteen one can enrol for the technical college.
